answers.answer: Just don't take the 3 hr one, but it might be possible that you had barely passed the test so they just want to make sure.

They did the exact same thing to me but that was early in my ppregnancy only 12 weeks in they had me doing the 3 hour test but that one came out normal. I am by no means over weight i am 5"6 and weigh 135  Im now 22 weeks and was told i would have to have abother at 24 weeks but its better to safe...the doctor usually knows whats best for you .

With my first born they just had me do the 3 hour one. I had my first test at 16 weeks then I ended up in the hospital with a uti an they had me do another hour test cause there was some sugar In my urine an then they tell me my results came back fine and when I went in for my follow up they said I have to take a 3 hour one when I go back at 28 weeks I'm just worried that they arent telling me something I should know.
They did the same to me but only because I am prediabetic.
I'm not. I've never been a diabetic. So idk what to do. Should I call them an see why I have to do another one.
I would call and ask why

question: So I already had taken my 1 hour test an I past but now my doctor Is still making me take the 3 hour one. Does anybody know why I have to take it if I passed. I thought that was only if you failed the test?? Should I be concerned????
title: gestational diabetes
